title: Academic Research Collaborative Data Interpretation Harmonizer
description: Upload and analyze multi-site academic research analysis summaries and metadata to produce structured comparison reports highlighting agreements, discrepancies, and harmonization suggestions.
inputLabel: Paste or upload your analysis summaries, metadata, and contextual notes
outputLabel: Structured comparison report with highlighted conflicts and harmonization suggestions
systemPrompt: You are a specialized assistant for academic research data analysts collaborating on multi-site study interpretation harmonization. Accept only uploads of supported file formats (text summaries, tables, figures) and metadata conforming to required schemas. Validate inputs strictly and reject unsupported or malformed content with clear error messages. Generate structured text reports highlighting agreements, discrepancies, and potential causes between uploaded data summaries. Provide harmonized interpretation suggestions while emphasizing that expert review is essential. Refuse any requests that attempt to replace expert judgment or handle unsupported workflows. Output must be plain text or valid JSON if structured-output is enabled. Do not produce visualizations or collaboration threads in this version. Enforce data privacy and security by not disclosing sensitive information beyond authorized users. Always require user authentication context for requests. If input is insufficient or ambiguous, prompt for clarification before proceeding.

presets.label: Summary Focus
presets.prompt: Focus on generating a clear and concise structured comparison report highlighting key agreements and discrepancies between the uploaded analysis summaries.

presets.label: Harmonization Focus
presets.prompt: Emphasize drafting harmonized interpretation suggestions, noting alternative viewpoints and potential causes of conflicts.

presets.label: Validation & Guidance
presets.prompt: Prioritize validating uploaded files and metadata for format and content correctness, providing detailed user guidance on errors.

jsonSchemaHint: If structured-output is enabled, output JSON with keys: agreements (array), discrepancies (array), potentialCauses (array), harmonizedInterpretation (string), alternativeViewpoints (optional array).
clarifyPrompt: Your input is missing required or valid data. Please upload supported analysis summaries, metadata, and contextual notes following the guidelines.
finalizePrompt: Review the generated structured comparison report and harmonization suggestions carefully. Remember this output aids but does not replace expert judgment.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Collaborative Data Interpretation Harmonizer

niche.scenario: Collaborative interpretation and synthesis of ambiguous or conflicting data analysis results from multi-site studies

idea.problem: In multi-site academic research projects, data analysts often generate differing interpretations or conflicting results from similar datasets due to varying analysis methods, assumptions, or contextual factors. Harmonizing these interpretations manually is time-consuming, error-prone, and hampers consensus building needed for reporting and decision-making.
inputs: Uploaded analysis result summaries (text, tables, or figures) from multiple sites or analysts
Metadata on analysis methods and assumptions (manual input or file upload)
Contextual notes explaining site-specific factors or data nuances
outputs: Structured comparison report highlighting agreements, discrepancies, and potential causes
Suggested harmonized interpretation draft with optional alternative viewpoints
Visualizations mapping interpretative differences and overlap
Collaboration workspace for discussion threads on key conflicting points
whyItWins: Addresses a critical and under-supported bottleneck in multi-site academic data synthesis workflows
Reduces manual coordination overhead and miscommunication by providing structured comparison and interpretation aids
Supports transparent documentation of disagreement rationale enhancing reproducibility and reporting quality
Facilitates iterative consensus building with integrated collaboration features
Distinct from existing tools focused on data cleaning, harmonization, or quality control by targeting post-analysis interpretation alignment

upgradePath.today: A single-page app to upload analysis summaries and metadata, producing a structured comparison report with highlighted conflicts and basic harmonized interpretation suggestions
upgradePath.in90Days: Add interactive visualization dashboards and collaboration threads allowing real-time discussion and annotation of conflicting points; enable user role-based permissions and versioned interpretation drafts
upgradePath.in12Months: Develop a full multi-page system supporting multi-format data import, advanced NLP-powered interpretation clustering, automated hypothesis conflict detection, integration with data repositories and manuscript drafting tools, and comprehensive audit trails for team workflows

riskNotes: Careful user guidance needed to avoid over-reliance on automated interpretation suggestions which cannot replace expert judgment
Sensitive collaborative content must be securely handled to protect unpublished research data and intellectual property
Complexity of diverse analysis methods may limit automated conflict detection accuracy; human review remains essential

blueprint.summary: A collaborative platform for academic research data analysts to upload, compare, and harmonize multi-site analysis interpretations, featuring structured reports, conflict visualization, and discussion workspaces to build consensus efficiently and transparently.
blueprint.primaryUser: Academic research team data analysts involved in multi-site studies
successMetrics: Reduction in time spent manually harmonizing conflicting analysis interpretations
User adoption rate among multi-site research teams
Number of consensus reports generated and collaboratively edited
Engagement metrics on discussion threads and collaboration workspaces
User satisfaction scores regarding clarity and usefulness of conflict visualizations and harmonization suggestions

components.name: Upload & Input Interface
components.responsibility: Allow users to upload analysis summaries, metadata, and contextual notes; validate inputs and provide guidance to avoid data quality issues.
notes: Supports multiple file formats (text, tables, figures) and manual metadata entry
Includes input validation and user guidance to mitigate risk of poor data quality

components.name: Data Ingestion & Validation API
components.responsibility: Receive, parse, and validate uploaded data and metadata; store validated inputs in the database; provide error feedback for malformed or incomplete submissions.
notes: Handles parsing of diverse input formats
Ensures data integrity and completeness before persistence

components.name: Persistent Data Storage
components.responsibility: Store uploaded analysis summaries, metadata, contextual notes, user profiles, interpretation drafts, discussion threads, and version histories securely.
notes: Supports versioning for interpretation drafts and discussion history

components.name: Interpretation Comparison & Harmonization Engine
components.responsibility: Analyze uploaded inputs to identify agreements, discrepancies, and potential causes; generate structured comparison reports and harmonized interpretation suggestions.
notes: Initial version uses rule-based heuristics; future upgrades to include NLP-powered clustering
Outputs structured data for visualization and collaboration

components.name: Comparison Report & Visualization UI
components.responsibility: Display structured comparison reports highlighting agreements and conflicts; provide visualizations mapping interpretative differences and overlaps.

components.name: Collaboration Workspace UI
components.responsibility: Enable threaded discussions, annotations on conflicting points, and editing/versioning of harmonized interpretation drafts with role-based permissions.
notes: Supports real-time updates and notifications in future upgrades
Includes permission controls to protect sensitive content

components.name: Interpretation Draft Versioning Job
components.responsibility: Automatically create and store version snapshots of interpretation drafts and discussion threads to enable audit trails and rollback.
notes: Runs on draft save events or at scheduled intervals
Ensures reproducibility and transparency of consensus building

dataModels.name: User
dataModels.purpose: Stores user profile and authentication information with role-based permissions

dataModels.name: AnalysisUpload
dataModels.purpose: Represents an uploaded analysis summary, metadata, and contextual notes from a site or analyst

dataModels.name: ComparisonReport
dataModels.purpose: Structured report highlighting agreements, discrepancies, and potential causes between multiple AnalysisUploads

dataModels.name: InterpretationDraft
dataModels.purpose: Draft harmonized interpretation with optional alternative viewpoints and version history

dataModels.name: DiscussionThread
dataModels.purpose: Threaded discussions and annotations on conflicting points within a ComparisonReport or InterpretationDraft

pages.title: Upload Analysis Summaries & Metadata
pages.purpose: Page for users to upload analysis result summaries, metadata, and contextual notes

pages.title: Comparison Report & Visualizations
pages.purpose: Displays structured comparison report with highlighted agreements, discrepancies, and visualizations

pages.title: Collaboration Workspace
pages.purpose: Workspace for threaded discussions, annotations, and editing interpretation drafts related to a specific report
inputs: User inputs in threads and drafts

pages.title: User Dashboard
pages.purpose: Overview of userâ€™s uploads, reports, and collaboration activities

apiRoutes.purpose: Receive and validate uploaded analysis summaries and metadata
apiRoutes.requestShape: { files: File[], metadata: JSON, contextualNotes: string }
apiRoutes.responseShape: { success: boolean, uploadId?: string, errors?: string[] }

apiRoutes.purpose: Create or update harmonized interpretation drafts
apiRoutes.requestShape: { comparisonReportId: string, content: string, alternativeViewpoints?: JSON, version?: number }
apiRoutes.responseShape: { success: boolean, draftId?: string, errors?: string[] }

apiRoutes.purpose: Post new discussion comments or replies
apiRoutes.requestShape: { relatedEntityId: string, parentId?: string, content: string }
apiRoutes.responseShape: { success: boolean, discussionId?: string, errors?: string[] }

apiRoutes.purpose: Fetch data required for interactive visualizations of interpretative differences

backgroundJobs.name: InterpretationDraftVersioning
backgroundJobs.trigger: On draft save or scheduled intervals
backgroundJobs.purpose: Create version snapshots of interpretation drafts and discussion threads for audit trail and rollback

edgeCases: Uploaded files with unsupported formats or corrupted content
Conflicting metadata or missing contextual notes leading to ambiguous comparison results
Simultaneous edits on interpretation drafts causing version conflicts
Unauthorized access attempts to sensitive unpublished research data
Over-reliance on automated harmonization suggestions without expert review
Network failures during large file uploads or real-time collaboration
Handling of very large multi-site datasets causing performance degradation
nonGoals: Automated replacement of expert judgment in interpretation decisions
Data cleaning, quality control, or raw data harmonization prior to analysis
Full manuscript drafting or publication management system
Real-time video or voice communication features
Support for non-academic or commercial data analysis workflows

dataFlow: User authenticates and accesses the Upload page (/upload).
User submits analysis summaries, metadata, contextual notes, and files via the Upload UI.
Upload UI sends POST request to /api/upload with files, metadata, and notes.
Data Ingestion API (/api/upload) parses, validates, and stores the data in the database (AnalysisUpload model).
Upon successful upload, the system triggers the Interpretation Comparison & Harmonization Engine to analyze new uploads and generate ComparisonReports.
ComparisonReport data is stored in the database and made available via /api/reports/:reportId.
User navigates to /reports/:reportId to view comparison reports and visualizations.
Report UI fetches report data from /api/reports/:reportId and visualization data from /api/visualizations/:reportId.
User accesses /collaboration/:reportId to participate in threaded discussions and edit InterpretationDrafts.
Collaboration UI fetches existing drafts and discussion threads from APIs and allows posting new drafts (/api/interpretation-drafts) and discussions (/api/discussions).
Background job 'InterpretationDraftVersioning' runs on draft saves or scheduled intervals to snapshot drafts and discussions for versioning and audit trails.
User dashboard (/dashboard) aggregates user uploads, recent reports, and active discussions by querying respective APIs.
validationRules: Upload API validates file formats against supported types (text, tables, figures) and rejects unsupported or corrupted files with descriptive errors.
Metadata fields must conform to predefined schemas (e.g., required fields, data types) and be consistent with uploaded files.
Contextual notes are optional but if provided, must be non-empty strings with a reasonable length limit (e.g., max 5000 characters).
ComparisonReport requests validate that reportId exists and user has access rights.
InterpretationDraft creation/update requires valid comparisonReportId, non-empty content, and version number for concurrency control.
Discussion posts require relatedEntityId to exist, content to be non-empty, and parentId (if provided) to reference an existing discussion comment.
All API requests require authenticated user sessions with role-based permission checks.
Version conflicts in InterpretationDraft updates are detected by comparing submitted version with latest stored version; conflicts return error requiring user to reload.
Inputs are sanitized to prevent injection attacks and ensure data integrity.
errorHandling: Upload API returns HTTP 400 with detailed error messages for validation failures (e.g., unsupported file format, missing required metadata).
APIs return HTTP 401 Unauthorized for unauthenticated requests and HTTP 403 Forbidden for unauthorized access attempts.
Version conflicts on draft updates return HTTP 409 Conflict with instructions to reload the latest draft.
Server errors return HTTP 500 with generic error messages; detailed errors logged internally for debugging.
Client-side UI displays user-friendly error messages and guidance based on API error responses.
Network failures during uploads or collaboration actions trigger retry mechanisms and user notifications.
APIs validate input shapes strictly and reject malformed requests with clear error descriptions.
securityNotes: All API routes require user authentication and enforce role-based access control.
Sensitive data (e.g., uploaded files, user credentials) is encrypted at rest in the database.
User passwords are stored as securely hashed values using strong algorithms (e.g., bcrypt).
Input sanitization is applied to prevent injection attacks (SQL, XSS).
Access to unpublished or sensitive research data is restricted based on user roles and ownership.
API endpoints validate user permissions before returning data or allowing modifications.
Versioning and audit trails enhance accountability and traceability of changes.
File uploads are scanned and validated to prevent malicious content.

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user on the /upload page with valid analysis files and metadata
acceptanceTests.when: The user submits the upload form
acceptanceTests.then: The system validates inputs, stores the upload, returns success with uploadId, and triggers report generation

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user requests a comparison report with a valid reportId
acceptanceTests.then: The system returns the structured report data and visualization data, which are displayed correctly

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user attempts to upload unsupported file formats
acceptanceTests.when: The user submits the upload form
acceptanceTests.then: The system rejects the upload with clear validation error messages

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user edits an interpretation draft with the latest version
acceptanceTests.when: The user submits the draft update
acceptanceTests.then: The system saves the draft, increments version, and returns success

acceptanceTests.given: Two users simultaneously edit the same interpretation draft
acceptanceTests.when: The second user submits an outdated version
acceptanceTests.then: The system returns a version conflict error prompting the user to reload

acceptanceTests.given: An unauthenticated user attempts to access /upload or API routes
acceptanceTests.when: The user tries to access protected pages or APIs
acceptanceTests.then: The system redirects to login or returns 401 Unauthorized

acceptanceTests.given: A user posts a new discussion comment with valid content
acceptanceTests.when: The user submits the discussion form
acceptanceTests.then: The system stores the comment and returns success with discussionId

acceptanceTests.given: The background job runs after draft save
acceptanceTests.when: A draft is saved or scheduled interval triggers
acceptanceTests.then: A version snapshot of the draft and related discussions is created and stored
The system displays the user's uploads, recent reports, and active discussion threads

buildOrder: Set up Prisma models and database schema for all data models
Implement authentication and role-based authorization middleware
Develop Data Storage layer with encryption and versioning support
Build API Ingestion endpoint (/api/upload) with file parsing and validation
Create Upload UI page with file input, metadata forms, and validation feedback
Implement Interpretation Comparison & Harmonization Engine API and data processing
Develop Comparison Report API (/api/reports/:reportId) and Visualization API (/api/visualizations/:reportId)
Build Report UI page to display comparison reports and visualizations
Implement Interpretation Draft API (/api/interpretation-drafts) with version control
Create Collaboration Workspace UI with discussion threads and draft editing
Implement Discussion API (/api/discussions) for threaded comments
Develop Background Job for Interpretation Draft Versioning
Build User Dashboard page aggregating uploads, reports, and discussions
Add comprehensive validation, error handling, and security checks
Write acceptance tests and perform end-to-end testing
